item.title: About
item.description: Welcome to theATL.social Contribute to theATL.social’s operations via Patreon ❤️ About theATL.social is a growing Mastodon server focused on the Atlanta, GA region. Questions about Mastodon, the Fediverse, ActivityPub, and all the other tech word things? Check out fedi.tips. Primary Admin Contact Email: michael@theatl.social Mastodon Username: @michael@theatl.social Secondary Admin Contact Email: theatl_admin@sigler.io Mastodon Username: @r@theatl.social Why have an Atlanta-focused server for Mastodon? People typically join small- to medium-sized servers based on some aspect of a server that personally appeals to them.

item.title: Bots
item.description: News and RSS Bots Contribute to theATL.social’s operations via Patreon ❤️ About “Bots” are accounts on theATL.social that automatically post news stories or timely information, based on updates to web pages or RSS feeds. Suggestions and feedback? Send a DM or mention @michael@theatl.social Update Frequency Bots are typically update every 30 minutes to 1 hour, daily. How to Follow a Bot Account Search for the account on theATL.social and follow the account.

item.title: FAQs
item.description: Contribute to theATL.social’s operations via Patreon ❤️ Where are your servers located? Are they in Atlanta? theATL.social operates on the DigitalOcean “cloud” computing provider, running in a data center in New York City (technically New Jersey). The choice of provider and data center is due to cost and availability of services. With additional funding, closer data centers to Atlanta may be utilized (for example, the AWS Atlanta local zone). Can I create an account on behalf of my business, non-profit organization, or representing any other group?

item.title: Funding
item.description: Contribute to theATL.social’s operations via Patreon ❤️ Background Mastodon server costs comprise payment for cloud-based servers, object storage, bandwidth, logging/monitoring, and other auxillary costs. As the number of users on a server increase, the cost per user decreases - an economy of scale. Current Costs Monthly instance costs comprise: Description Vendor Monthly Cost Security, Object Storage, DDOS Protection CloudFlare $25 Email Providers SendGrid $20 Cloud-based Servers, Block Storage DigitalOcean $90 Container Repository + Docker Repo License Docker Hub $7 Why is this more expensive than a hosted service from masto.

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.description: Last updated Jan 22, 2023 This privacy policy describes how theATL.social (“theATL.social”, “we”, “us”) collects, protects and uses the personally identifiable information you may provide through the theATL.social website or its API. The policy also describes the choices available to you regarding our use of your personal information and how you can access and update this information.
